J49t195VphIFvV4AHuBM4Q.text: Best IPA I have had since traveling around England and Scotland.  I am blown away by how great this place is in a tourist area.  Haggis and Venison burger are exceptional and the presentation of the meal was more than I expected. Service is excellent. Toffee pudding was moist and sweet but well balanced with the vanilla ice cream. I had to be rolked back to my hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, Steak &amp; Ale Pie, Venison Burger

eCVE74BU-Tj-a8-411G8hQ.text: The atmosphere was nice. The food was good, fish and chips was a nice portion while my partner had salmon filet. Hers was also delicious. The wait was a bit long but I suppose it was a bit busy. Overall I'm satisfied

vxZrQ53YZm3tB4VWmyDoDw.text: We tried just about everything on the menu. All was delicious. Best Hagis Neeps and Tatties, and Mint Lamb Chops I've ever had. I think it is safe to say that you will be satisfied with whatever you order. Nice atmosphere and friendly service.

45px09MkgBFfDlO3Lx56gg.text: Went here with friends for brunch. Good food and nice selection of breakfast options for those in the mood for a big hearty breakfast.

RAebem_kUdT-xk9_A8Q1LA.text: We got the whisky flight, haggis tower, and the venison. It was amazing. Great service, great food and great vibe.

V6C5wC6M4Auv588EyvK_Vw.text: I was here in June. Yep it's in the tourist strip but their tea was pretty good (not difficult) but I also ordered the haggis.  I have had homemade haggis and this was close. I was a bit alarmed when I saw how it was served (stacked along with neeps and tatties with gravy all around it). I would rather them be separated but it was still enjoyable.  There was a musician out side of the pub which made the sunny day in Edinburgh even better.  Staff was friendly and patient when I asked if I could wait to order my lunch after my tea.  The place has an awesome ambience and it was super clean.

0KKvlZ5fbaZQKjpI8WjZrA.text: Sticky Toffee Pudding is AMAZING!  Skip the whisky sauce on the chicken and haggis, it's better with out it.

OrfIq-ATOYXlHDKLPYUrWQ.text: The tour guide to the highlands recommended this place so we knew we couldn't go wrong.  When we got there, the place was packed - another good sign.  We had the fish and chips and ribs as appetizers - gotta get the ribs - sauce was fantastic - not the traditional thick molasses stuff but a sauce that was more like au jus style - the taste to die for - meat fell off the bone - tender and flavorful.  The portion was big enough for 4 people to have 2 pieces each.  Fish was fresh and crispy - cooked just right.  Definitely would go back.    Only complaint was that service was a bit slow as it was 2 waitresses managing the whole restaurant but we noticed that inmany restaurants in Scotland

f0pdpYpDNsx1VV-ArNWA4Q.text: A bit touristy, right on the Royal Mile, you can tell they are used to frustrating situations with tourists. We didn't try any food but had drinks at the bar. Service was fine, as I remember the toilets were pretty gross...

v0zsaYMbiTdrMtmivLBMSA.text: Best meal I enjoyed in Scotland - fresh mussels with a side of perfectly prepared chips.  My lactose-intolerant husband was looking forward to some haggis, so the staff splendidly went out of their way to prepare it sans butter and other dairy and it was still excellent.  The charming and friendly servers along with a superb sampling of whiskeys made for a really memorable little lunch.  There is no shortage of bars and cafes to pick from so I'm glad we were lucky enough to stumble upon it!

89wJQUR8D_CPmlzprFDmrg.text: A small bar on The Royal Mile, I must have walked past it hundreds of times without giving it a second glance, dismissing it as a typical tourist bar. Friends brought it to my attention when they dropped in for a quick drink and we have visited it numerous times since.  It IS small and can get pretty busy, they have a few tables outside which obviously attracts a lot of custom when the weather is good. The staff are very friendly and efficient, but you should make allowances for speed of service during busy periods especially during The Fringe. Reserving a table ahead of time is recommended if possible.  It is pretty much what you would expect from a "traditional Scottish" pub, with a selection of beers including three real ale casks, which are usually from small Scottish breweries, a beer "flight" is also available, allowing you to buy a third of a pint of each ale. They also have an extensive menu of approximately 50 whiskies (although some we asked for were not available), broken down by areas of the distillery. They offer a selection of whisky "flights", 4 whiskies based around a theme or area with prices varying to match (around 3 or 4 a glass). Being on the Royal Mile prices are possibly a bit inflated, but not excessively so, and are comparable to elsewhere on The Mile and central Edinburgh.  The food is also fairly "traditional" Scottish pub food, including dishes like Cullen Skink or haggis fritter for starters and  main courses like burgers, fish and chips and haggis, neeps and tatties, etc. The food is not just "pub grub" but of a good restaurant quality. I had a tower of Haggis, Neeps & Tatties (each layered on the other) which had an onion & rosemary gravy. I would have preferred a more traditional whisky cream sauce (which you do get with their haggis beefburger), but the gravy was good. None of our party had starters, but a couple of us did order dessert, the main complaint with the sticky toffee pudding was it was too large! I personally had the Cranachan (whipped cream, whisky soaked oatmeal, raspberries & honey) which was delicious!  In summary: good Scottish beers, good Scottish food and good Scottish whiskies.   N.B. They do a "loyalty card" which gives you a 10% discount on food and drink (see their website for how to apply).

irzWB7EFz1CSW7I-rnO-xQ.text: This was my first meal in Edinburgh and set the tone for our entire weekend there, and the tone was a good one! Royal McGregor was recommended to us by our host and I can see why. The restaurant is tucked away on High Street and is home to one of the most charming servers I have ever met. I can't remember her name but she was French and just so lovely. I ordered the goat cheese sandwich and she informed me that the cheese was late coming to the restaurant that day so I changed  my order to the BLT. Just as my companions' meals were coming, out server informed me that the cheese had arrived and that she was having a sandwich prepared for me. It was so kind and unexpected of her! The sandwich was amazing, and the cheese was very fresh.

ICdwzDfZlo2NDspDnxrtJw.text: Truly heavenly lamb chops with a really good sea bass as well.  Got us seated right away, the char on the lamb was perfect, cooked to order. Took a bit while checking out but overall a very good place that justifies its high rating.

DAoGaTXv3PuMGwRwLBKFLA.text: Neat little pub, decent (albeit not particularly great) food and a good selection of wines & whiskies.   Sticky Toffee junkies be warned, it's only so-so.  We went there after reading rave reviews of the sticky toffee pudding, which is my favorite dessert in the world.  It was "OK", a solid 7 out of 10.

2BEhQwUNflxS5EQBflQrag.text: Great Service, good beer selection and very good fish and chips! Wait staff was very knowledgeable of are and have great sightseeing tips.

UBGtUP7eDlYDdN6EKgRktQ.text: A simply fantastic traditional Scottish breakfast!!! I've had black pudding before that was pretty disgusting, but what is served here was absolutely outstanding. The portions were more than adequate to say the least, and I'd like to go back there for breakfast tomorrow. Great location on the Royal Mile. Highly recommended!!

sHlRL9dageNViYToutQHCg.text: Sure, it was lazy of me to choose a restaurant right on High Street, but it was my first evening in Edinburgh after an overnight transatlantic flight with little sleep, at the end of a long day of walking and sightseeing, and I just didn't want to have to work at it.    The service was crappy, even for Britain, but the food was decent.  I had haggis fritters, which I figured would be a gentle introduction to the famous dish, served with a honey/chili sauce.  My entree was the mixed grill, with lamb (A), steak (B+), pork/leek sausage (C), served with grilled mushrooms and onions and baked potato discs.

0OARIS2D18tUAHVQwgnWGQ.text: Friendly pub with great food. The beer taster is a good way try out three beers without getting full sized (or full priced) drinks.

OsZSCnqnUU9coSLDNFmYcg.text: Definitely a perennial favorite whenever in Edinburgh! Whether it's fish and chips, haggis fritters or tower or whatever, the meal is always delicious complete with a great presentation. Wait staff has always been good and the cooks excellent. If you're here in the summer best get a reservation or there may not be a table. And try the sticky toffee pudding--to die for!!

uDlVwRn2KqOWlGgIums2ng.text: Even though this place is off the "touristy" Royal Mile, it really has great food. My husband and I ate there twice, dinner and breakfast, and both were delicious. I have to say that the Traditional Scottish breakfast was one of the best breakfasts of the trip.

vrHWqDEc_WUTpYs4PEEvXQ.text: I liked the vibe of this place.  Everyone was quite friendly.  The fish and chips were good (biiig piece of fish). My wife enjoyed the pie.  Will come again the next time I'm in town.

GKoS9hhPBDEljVI2zaXHmQ.text: It was pretty inside but hotttt in the summer with no AC. The food was not well seasoned- my steak and ale pie was so salty I almost sent it back. My husband's crofter's chicken was great but the sauce was totally bland. On the plus side, they are clean and the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak and ale pie- salty but super filling! Crofter&#39;s chicken- a nice pairing of haggis and chicken.

_zooMw6by8PBLQ6uBvKf-g.text: I went to dinner here because it was recommended for its Haggis but decided to try something else because I had a different restaurant.  We had the salmon and venison casserole the first time there.  It was delicious.  The salmon was moist and flavorful.  The venison casserole had venison, rabbit and hare.  It was delicious.  It was slightly peppery and the meats were tender.  The whole meal was so good we went back two more times.  We went to breakfast and had the full fry.  At first I thought it was so little but once I started eating, it was just right.  It had sausage, bacon, egg, whole wheat toast, tattie scone, Haggis, blood sausage, tomato, mushrooms and beans.  It was not greasy and not salty.  We went back for dinner the same day.  This time we had the haggis tower and the pork belly.  The haggis was great.  It was moist with a great whiskey sauce.  You'll need reservations for dinner.  The place is small, maybe 12 tables.  They have a loyalty card which will give you 10% off.  The service was very good also.  Very nice waitresses.  Recommend it for the haggis.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Without Beans
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. With Beans

G5_9K0dL7BVxcJUTHk49MA.text: If you are looking for a cozy pub on the Royale Mile that has great food and a very knowledgeable staff on Scottish whisky, this is the place!  This was our first restaurant on our vacation to Scotland and it met all expectations. I also have a gluten allergy and they were very cooperative and had a separate menu for me (which I greatly appreciated!).  We went back for breakfast and when they served my meal they left the toast on top (I have to be careful with cross contamination) after I said I have a gluten allergy. Now this is partly my fault since I didn't explicitly say to leave the toast off.

K8d1OIAv3d1-t9n86PKJ0g.text: We came her for dessert after having dinner nearby.   We ordered a sticky toffee pudding, a cranachan, and a "wee taster". The two desserts were both phenomenal. I have tried sticky toffee pudding several times and this one was by far the best. The cranachan was delicious and rich, defiantly something you need to try while in Scotland.   My only complaint was that two of the beers in my beer taster were warm. There was only three beers total in it so it was pretty disappointing that two of them were warm.

OhYTeFLJHeIAJcCWHq3OUw.text: I come here each time I'm in Edinburgh. The service is very friendly. Two favorite things on the menu are the Cullen skink and Crofters chicken. Good portions and a great price. Also the sticky toffee pudding is delicious. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a simple sit down meal.

moddpzSIWUPvi6mzngpn9Q.text: Nice outside seating area on the Royal Mile . Food was tasty but nothing spectacular. Fish and chips was good but the chips were not from fresh cut potatoes(home fries) the way I think of fish and chips

wZsWowlg21PJ1o3v6fLyEA.text: Absolutely loved this gem of a restaurant! Food was exceptional! Waiters and bartenders were excellent! Got to try 2 local favorites - finally tried the haggis fritters and

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3kLw-NA8dpCC_-4FrCQcBg.text: The name and the outside looked too stiff, too formal. Surely the food is expensive and staid, I thought. But another reviewer here said it had the best haggis he had in Scotland, and that persuaded me to give it a try. Now I had never had haggis and I wanted to try it with the best. While I can't compare it to others, I thought the Tower of Haggis was an amazing adventure. The meat was peppery delicious and with the mashed potatoes and wonderful brown gravy, it was a little reminiscent of comfort food back home of a very good beef Manhattan except with a great peppery kick. The potato wedges were also exceptional in that they were fresh, hot, and crispy. For dessert the sticky toffee pudding served with ice cream was warm and sweet in all the right places. My wife thought it was worth a return trip. I thought the entire meal was worth this review. Don't miss The Royal MacGregor on the Royal Mile in Edinburgh. I so glad I didn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Stuckey Toffee Pudding with ice cream, mmmmmm.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tower of Haggis with gravy and Potato wedges and Irn-Bru, a traditional Scottish meal.

ExPKxbM1jP9dB7ZB6OoUZw.text: Good atmosphere, friendly service and good selection of whisky to complement your food with. Tiny tables yet cozy. Steaks are OK albeit bit thin but the burgers are really good, in particular the one with haggis.

vFAqQmnV6G0oHg-OR24jFg.text: We were warmly welcomed even with our three children and treated to wonderful, quick food. Service was friendly and helpful as well and the atmosphere is great for that Scottish experience.

-JQCLjCUiDq75ynh5WKXsw.text: The BIG breakfast is, well... big. And awesome. Quiet, small establishment with friendly and efficient service. The food was well priced and delicious. The menu is not extensive but it doesn't need to be when it's well done. Thanks.

yxB2OCvgn2Gvec3lT_scAw.text: We went here for our first dinner in Scotland.  I got a Bulmer's cider which is one of my favoroite drinks.  We had to try the haggis fritters and they were delicious!  I feel like it was not really trying haggis because it was deep fried and had a sweet chili sauce.  But I loved the sauce and it was so good.  We got the fish and chips and shepard's pie to share.  Both were amazing!  The shepards pie was made with lamb which is not my favorite but it worked really well in this.  The fish and chips was one of my favorite on the trip, including all the times we had it in London!  We also got the sticky toffee pudding which came with ice cream.  It was amazing... hot and flavorful and the ic cream totally complimented the sticky toffee.  The waitress was very friendsly and gave honest recommendations.  I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. fish and chips and shepard&#39;s pie
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. haggis fritters

HYHZg4odg2sbfc-SRj5ALg.text: Great bar on the Royal Mile with a cozy atmosphere. Had the Scottish breakfast with a perfectly done flat white. The plate was piled high and I had doubts I could finish it. After trying the haggis, sausage, bacon, mushrooms, black pudding, eggs, tomatoes, beans and some flat bread I couldn't stop eating until it was gone. The prices were very reasonable and servers were nice.

mIMYX6XtnMYM0W20M-TI9w.text: We called in here when we had just arrived in Edinburgh lovely place friendly staff had a lovely club sandwich and chunky chips nice glass wine hit the spot

0ubRdG5Z2U4icavZYdDQ6Q.text: Tasty traditional Scottish food, quick service, and not badly priced. Best part: desert! Was looking for a place to enjoy a traditional Scottish meal before leaving Edinburgh and after reading the reviews tried this place out. It definitely lived up to the reviews and I highly recommend it.

nfoWUBSXRKHPbi2AIFyNIQ.text: We arrived at a busy time but the Wee Sampler kept us going until a table was ready. We had the ribs with sweet potato fries as well as beef stew pie for main after the smoked salmon starter. All excellent. Great little pub, authentic atmosphere and good kitchen.  Well worth the visit.

o7NF78stnsXIpZW0sfoeMw.text: We didn't have any food here, just hot drinks and they were amazing! It isn't like anything we have back in our home countries so it was something new! I also loved the atmosphere and the staff, who was very friendly and willing to help the tourists!

pojzEL8-VL_u1DDypv3M6w.text: Large portions. Fish and chips were a bit greasy. Coffee good. Chips very good. Service was pleasant and chatty.

Q92J_P5DiuFXMAK-S_VhhA.text: This was by far the most forgettable place we went in Scotland/Edinburgh. Not sure if it was the time or day or our mood but we enjoyed a largely boring meal and I cannot, for the life, of me, remember what I ate.   WAIT, I do remember! I ate a brie and spinach pie and the side salad with cherry tomatoes was actually the highlight. Yeah, overall, not a bad place. But forgettable.

pKdAeZi-trXV4AZRj5kCfA.text: Thoughts the Royal Mile, this establishment has a real authentic feel with both locals and visitors dining in and enjoying!  Came here late after a very long day trip in the highlands, seeking comfort food. This pub delivered!  We had some great Scotch ales which were just wonderful!  I had Fish 'n' Chips which were savory, salty, crispy and perfect! Great big chips too!  Mum had the Bleu Burger which was rich and hearty.  Fair prices for a great meal and nice experience.  The service staff is very friendly and accommodating.  It all hit the spot after 13 hour journey around the highlands and lochs.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bleu Burger
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish &#39;N&#39; Chips

7OaLLRzc3_PSeunDXnSxzg.text: Low Cost, High quality breakfast.  I stopped by after seeing advertising on Yelp for it. It was a mile walk, but it was well worth it, located on the Royal Mile, it's a nice comfy little pub. I ordered the Scottish Breakfast, which had all the requirements: Egg, Black sauasage, toast, Haggis, mushrooms, and more.  Every bit of it was great. Adimttedly, as an American, I wasn't sure what to expect with Haggis, but was great.

064pHs1BqAsBAxmBrQ-eQg.text: Nice pub on the Royal Mile.  Good service and good food.  We got in without a reservation but I got the sense that was lucky.  Plan accordingly.

heoYaXh2snnLLbjSnsE1dA.text: Popped in for a quick pint and couldn't be more pleased with the service. Didn't eat there so can't comment on the food but glad we stopped in.

fqLXeGOasvyUDBNqEyqlxA.text: This place was so good! I had the haggis neeps & tatties, and my husband had the risotto which was phenomenal. Friendly staff with a lively buzz. I highly recommend this place as your first dining experience in Edinburgh just like it was for us:)

Ii-coG4HeoMA8wgJ4Z5HXQ.text: Very nice food here! The service was absolutely superb, I would highly recommend. Also the food was extremely quick to come out and was very reasonably priced too.

QFT0D6jGF8JyIP_FLum01w.text: Very good service, food, and drinks. Would come back for a more substantial meal since we only had some chips and cider.

p0MTAaXJHfmr7t0AKpXE8Q.text: My family came here while visiting Edinburgh. Our ancestors were Scottish and we're descendants of the McGregor Clan, so when we saw this quaint little pub on the Royal Mile, we couldn't resist.   This is a great place to come when you want to rest your legs, warm your bones, and escape the crowds. It's right on the main road from the Castle to the Palace, so it was surprising that it was so quiet.   I personally ordered the Mature Cheddar Panini. For all you Americans out there; "Rocket" is the term they use for Arugula. They use this term all over the UK and it confused the living hell out of us, until I finally asked what the heck it was. And it was Arugula. Go figure. So anyway, the panini comes with Arugula and tomato chutney. It was pretty good, but I thought it was missing something. Perhaps some onions?   Others in my party enjoyed the Pulled Pork Burger and the Fish and Chips. Apparently the Fish and Chips were a tad too greasy. But there were no complaints about the burgers.   Finally, some of us got a couple beers on tap. Unfortunately, I don't remember the names but I know they were local and it was a special Christmas brew. As this is beer country, they were delicious and refreshing. Word of the wise; if you're in the UK and you go to any old pub, order beer. There's no excuse not to.   This was a cool spot and a nice moment for us Americans to enjoy. It looks and feels like a traditional pub, so we had a great time. The food wasn't awe inspiring, but after miles of walking, all we really wanted was some warmth and some food in our bellies. And this was the perfect place to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Mature Cheddar Panini.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Pulled Pork Burger.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A spot of tea.

Uebok_COt0B2CcBOtleLhg.text: My wife and I were visiting Edinburgh for vacation and while cruising the Royal Mike stumbling upon this place while walking one evening. It was an awesome discovery. We sat outside and split the sea bass and cheese plate and she had a couple glasses of wine while I tried a few of the local brews on tap. The food and prices were great, the serves was awesome and the atmosphere was fun. We highly recommend it !!!

ghJhkBvmDF_Cg8_awZRvcQ.text: Wonderful food and even better hospitality.  The crofter's chicken and steak and ale pie were wonderful.  Don't forget to have the toffee pudding as desert.

mt2KPN3D7SJqEzcccapG3g.text: We stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night and the pub was almost packed.  Ok first off, the service is really great.  Sitting across from the bar you could see how hard everyone was working to make the place hum.  More importantly the drinks and food matched the quality of places we had paid double for on this trip.  You could tell the kitchen takes the time to plate properly for a nice presentation in addition to cooking it nearly perfectly - way beyond what you expect from pub grub!  Cullen skink (a fish chowder of smoked haddock, potatoes and cream soup) - this was really tasty but could have had a few more pieces of fish and a bit less potato.  Chicken stuffed with haggis - the chicken was baked and was a bit dry in spots but the rest was fine.  The combination with the haggis was really tasty and made up for the chicken.  Tower of haggis - this is built from mashed potatoes and mashed turnips with haggis on the bottom surrounded by a moat of gravy.  I was glad there was a lot of gravy because the tower was so big I ended up using it all up.  Again highly recommended.  If you haven't had haggis before, make this the place you try it first.  It was really great!

xxVdnYfJtfq-Rh77sN98UQ.text: Had a nice relaxing snack and a couple of pints after a walk around the castle and the royal mile.

X3dAS9SjWLi25zexhZtOQA.text: They have an excellent breakfast here if you're a hungry traveler. Get one of the full breakfast plates. Service was really good.

KBE88ok7WBqIvi-JuIgH4A.text: I needed a break from walking from HolyRood Palace to Edinburgh Castle.  And by break, I mean pints and pints of cask ale.  This is a quaint spot on the Royal Mile to get your drinks on and max.  Sweet interior with a semi-modern, semi-traditional decor.  Chill bartender and festive patronage.  I'd hit it again.  Aye.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yup
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskaaay...aye, the menu tells yah a story mate.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I point when I&#39;m a wee bit drunk.

n-OUtcEB1Gb_1vgXPF5usA.text: Excellent service, great beers, good food. We had fish and chips, good but not among the best I've had, vege haggis with turnips and potatoes, very good, and steak and ale pie, very good.

7jU-qiYnJAVMClahVKZIEQ.text: During my three week trip to London, England, Scotland, and Paris, the Royal McGregor had the best thing I ate.....the Scottish Mussels with White Wine Cream Sauce. They were absolutely divine and tender. Instead of Mussels being served in some sort of broth, these were drenched in the sauce which clung to the tender Mussels. And the wonderful french bread that was served soaked up all of the deliciousness left in the bottom of the bowl. I can't say enough how wonderful the Mussels were. The haggis here was also very enjoyable.

tnYwi3d5ov7WDDGIR1AUzw.text: The Cullen sink was decent. The burgers were excellent! The sea bass was perfectly cooked. The service fell off when the food was delivered. We had to ask another waitress to help us and get us a bill.

wLQ3Z-Fh786VtKLCGOoZ6Q.text: I loved this pub on the Royal Mile. I couldn't handle Haggis Tower, so had Chicken breast stuffed with Haggis with vegetables on the side. It was very good, and I enjoyed my half pint of lager with it.

EWHEkXySaHWkL-UkDzoGwA.text: Great pub! Very welcoming. The waitress noticed we were from Chicago. Asked on my White Sox hat  and mentioned her love of our fair city. She recommended our beers for the stay and gave us a few sport to hit in town. The atmosphere was great. Inviting.  The beers and food were excellent. It had outdoor seating as well.

HoXIi3IkZ-DdpXaYIgJ8sA.text: Wonderful find. Like a local pub but in the Royal mile.   Food was excellent and service was friendly.  Reasonable pricing as well

vZCIGOrlh7dbXxU6MmXIZA.text: Good food and great atmosphere. Make sure to make a reservation. Not a very big place so you can't just walk in and grab a table.

QTvOoxUTUtVJRxUoT6U_xg.text: I came to this pub expecting a better meal. Got the fish and chips and the fish was about double the breading I would have liked and there wasn't much flavor. I understand cod isn't that flavorful to begin with but their breading could have at least enhanced the experience, instead it just weighted the meal down.  On the other hand, my beer was great and it seems like a fairly traditional pub so if you're looking to grab a drink with friends, not a bad stop.

jqVCPzYvHsdPVOPrHk2xjQ.text: We just dropped in for a couple of ciders and some sticky toffee pudding. This is a charming and busy spot - but we enjoyed our time. Service was passable. Drinks were good, of course. And I really liked our sticky toffee dessert - it was just the right size for sharing. Four out of five stars because the service was just okay - and I think I'd probably pass on this place if I visited the area again.

A2bg26cet6Z8dhKpMLTiaw.text: After some guidance from the bartender and server, the scotch flight and cheeseboard were excellent. Once the kitchen was getting backed up, but instead of cramming customers in, they explained and turned some away so they could focus on the customers already seated. Great food, great service,

9BoDOPg3HaaVrPsGPI5nvg.text: Hagis tower and Steak Ale Pie were amazing! This is our first restaurant in Edinburgh and first impression is everything. Every bites is better than the first one. We will have to come back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

rMp3P-gobocX-ENNciU60w.text: Amazing sticky toffee pudding! Great customer service and would definitely return again

wjAGcd_5prBEJPvHdCMdcw.text: Had the wee flight and the salmon. The whiskey is good and the beer is good and the food is great pub food. Just what we needed after a day of sightseeing!

OF-KKqZo0rHuEniV1Yk4Bg.text: We had to try the Haggis! I'd only had deep fried Haggis so this Haggis Tower was unique. Only regret was getting gravy instead of the whiskey sauce, don't make that same mistake - get the whiskey sauce!!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Tower with gravy

8b9nIng1Kb5KCioPzjRS4g.text: Sooooo good!!! We were only in Edinburgh for a short time and wanted to sample local food so found this place as we were walking through the main 'drag' - High Street.  Service was wonderful with the staff working so quickly to find us a table inside as it was quite chilly for outdoor seating. The number of tables is limited in this small space and it is very popular so having a reservation or sitting outside is a good idea.  The food was utterly divine! I tried one of the rare whiskey that was recommended from one of the whiskey flights - highly recommend having a whiskey with your dinner as they offer numerous options from different areas of Scotland. Vegetarian options were quite numerous which was rare to find in our travel through the UK and they also offer salads and fresh veggies (another rare find). Traditional dishes with new twists - had the haggis fritters which I could have eaten many of! They even offer vegetarian haggis! Food was super tasty and highly recommend as a delicious eatery stop for anyone traveling through Edinburgh who wants to try local fare.

NFQeLNPeLhfk9Y7uzIycxQ.text: Nothing amazing, but the food was good. I was there for a Scottish breakfast and I liked it. Staff also was nice and polite.

PtCLCvMimVJ5EtE2gzDKCA.text: This place was out of this world good.  Delicious food, great cocktails and attentive service.  Who could ask for more?!!!

POZtyWQh6bclXnT9cdlLtg.text: We wanted to find a cozy place for dinner on this rainy night, and this place was perfect! They have an extensive whiskey menu and all the servers are very nice. The restaurant is not very big so either be prepared to wait, or you can call ahead and make a reservation. We made a reservation, and the table was ready for us when we arrived. Unfortunately I wanted their mussels, but they were out (guess that means they're really good!) so I got the curry instead. I wouldn't really recommend the curry as it was a bit watery, and on top of rice noodles which I found a bit odd. And since they came out together, the noodles were very soggy and thin by the time I ate it. It almost felt like just eating soup with vegetables. I will say however my friends for the chicken and beef pies, and those were VERY good. I would recommend the beef pie.   We ended the night with whiskey flights which was also pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Logo
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey flight (Islay one)
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef pie

w3SfU_Xg0E1oaqPZHtCAJw.text: Cullen Skink, smoked haddock and potato soup; Cranachan, a dessert made with oats, both available, along with haggis.   Reservations are recommended, unless you come off peak dining hours.  We we're nearby the castle and looking for Scottish pub fare.  They were fully booked, but they accommodated us at the bar.  We observed that the tables cleared once we were ready to leave ourselves.

cushbs7e4yK4zXiUHABpbQ.text: Had my first full Scottish breakfast, first taste of haggis and black pudding. They are quite good, so if you're from out of the country you should definitely give it a try. The restaurant was well located and easy to find, a little tight on space so you get a lot of people brushing into you or pushing past to get around. The food was pretty good, as a carb connoisseur I thought the bread was amazing. Solid choice for breakfast.

-X57G7PG4wNDFgEvmCZvLA.text: So good. Great service, friendly staff. It was a first for me to try the whisky and the server recommended one from the Highland. I also enjoyed the Innis and Gunn local Edinburgh lager. SO GOOD. Nice and light beer.  We ordered the fish and chips and the Haggis Tower. Delicious!!!! Fish came piping hot. Could have used more chips though! The mushy peas were great.  My Haggis Tower was not as hot as I would like in temperature. But I'm used to eating haggis now hhahha! Overall great experience. This place was recommended by the info center when we had first arrived.

3KIQCSUh4QLC__s-fr4ByA.text: A wee dram?  Oh h e double l no.  After three flights, four airports, 12 time zones and 22  hours of travel; three fingers please!  Listed as one of 55 recommended restaurants in the Michelin Guide for Edinburgh, this one was admittedly chosen for their selection of whiskey.  Of course the food is good.  For starters, the first taste of cold smoked Scottish salmon.  Incredibly rich, fatty, very smooth mouth feel.  The intense razor sharp flavor of salmon, unmistakable.  The game terrine, outstanding.  Course ground bits of this and that with a light livery flavor and anise overtones.  Great texture unfortunately, the traditional oatcakes; lets just say horse biscuits are not for me.  For mains, a dish known as Crofters Chicken (oven baked chicken breast stuffed with hagggis served with a whisky sauce, sauteed cabbage and root veg).  A brilliant way to introduce haggis to the uninitiated.  The mineral, livery flavor of the offal is mellowed by the chickeny, poultry flavor.  The jus from the chicken moistens the haggis.  The whisky sauce adding a velvity, rich, concentrated whisky flavor to the dish.  Good eats.  Very good selection of whisky (nearly 100), many offered in flights for tasting.  All flights come complete with the requisite water and chocolates.  Do not be that guy who asks for ice.  They will frown at that faux pas as it will cloud the whisky and ruin it.  Friendly service.  Very reasonably priced.  Mains average 12.  A charming, fairly priced pub with great whisky and food.  A fitting welcome to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky tasting done right.  Dark chocolate and all.

6QIWSaIENdFJYJzrmgKHog.text: Last month, when I was in Edinburgh, I dined at the Royal McGregor and I am so glad I did!  It was totally amazing!  My friends convinced me to try Haggis, so I started with the "introductory" Haggis Fritters and they were actually really good!  I really enjoyed them.  For my main course, I ordered the vegetarian haggis tower which was spectacular!  The veggie haggis was quite spicy but it was so good.  For dessert, I had the Crannachan which was totally amazing! The service here was very good, and there are tons of beverage options.  The prices are quite reasonable also. The restaurant isn't too large, but it is cozy and the tables are comfortable.  It is conveniently located on the Royal Mile. I would highly recommend the Haggis Fritters and the Haggis tower/Veggie Haggis tower.  You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Fritters
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetarian Haggis Tower

TyPt0-BhZzYaXILpuF-rGw.text: Ok. I was initially skeptical as this place is right in the middle of a very touristy area. I could not have been more pleased. We had the haggis tower with whiskey sauce and it was absolutely fabulous. As was the mint marinated lamb chops. Roast chicken stuffed with haggis was also excellent. Overall a really nice experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb chops
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis tower.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish chips

-M82Qbysh-SHTI_j8jmXZw.text: We stopped in for lunch and highly recommended haggis.  Did not disappoint for sure.  I had the haggis with the whiskey cream sauce.  Wow what a treat.  Even my wife and son had some and they enjoyed.  Wife had the Vegetarian Haggis, she enjoyed also.  Being made of lentils and beans, not as moist but still very good.  Kids had a pasta dish, not bad and the bbq chicken legs...which both enjoyed and polished off.  Oh and of course I had a whiskey flight which was a nice mid day treat, well presented and very good value for what was served!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mac and cheese!
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. BBQ chicken legs
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Tower

5HEDj88l4Cfcy-kuRzsAuw.text: First pub we tried on our first day in Edinburgh. Quaint atmosphere with seating in an elevated area at the back. Haggis tower was sublime. Don't be afraid!  A three-layer tower of haggis, neeps and tatties, all drizzled with the most incredible whiskey gravy. MUST HAVE!  You can skip the burgers though. Patties are very dense and dry. Service is a little slow so make sure you have plenty of time.

rCachivtNspwuWjRiI7MQg.text: We had an amazing dinner at the Royal McGregor. My husband and I shared the vegetarian haggis and the fisherman's pie. We loved both, but the fisherman's pie was the favorite. Our server had excellent suggestions for gin sampling to pair with the cranachan that we ordered for desert. It was sublime! Really happy memories of delicious food and wonderful service at the Royal McGregor. Thank you!

7839LhykqdBWb-1eNVDWSQ.text: Happy we dropped in.  I ordered the Scottish Breakfast, my wife ordered the Traditional Breakfast, and we each ordered a Flat White.  Food was very good, and the coffee was amazing. Way better than anywhere we stopped for coffee in London OR Paris. Also the quaintness of the outdoor patio... Amazing.  Everyone should come here for breakfast, honestly!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Flat White
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish Breakfast
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Flat White

s2J9ISUR1F4_s89y0S2UgA.text: Great British pub in old town. Great food and service. Great location. Fish and chips and a pint,

linXZZRQ2IjKh3EtGhda1g.text: We came here for breakfast and was pleasantly satisfied. Our server was lovely and our Irish coffees were smooth. It was my first time trying haggis and it was a good first time. Our bacon was full of flavor and paired well with the toast. The portion size was fine and the price was comparable.  I enjoyed the ambience of the place as well. Spacious and dark but not too dark. I would come back.

GwRmhmPZXyA-UIH7wZY40A.text: Great food! The pies are amazing! I think our group had 3 or 4 different pies (duck, chicken and beef) and they were all superb. Great fish and chips too! The staff was friendly and the decor/environment was nice.

GHl6Hl9R-_aia1OQoJwSCQ.text: At that point of our vacation, we were both looking for a meal with greens, or something vegetarian, or something...just something not all meat-based. We walked the Mile one or two times, stopping to view menus, before popping in here for lunch.  We decided to share a bowl of Cullen Skink before ordering our main meals: Halloumi Burger for me, and the Highland Burger for him.  I was blown away by the Cullen Skink - it was like the Boston chowder that I know from home, but a million percent better. It was smoky but creamy, with giant chunks of fish. It was served with a couple pieces of bread, which we definitely used to sop up all the good stuff.  The halloumi burger was a new one for me; I'd never had halloumi before. The cheese was a bit...chewy?...and became difficult to eat as there were two pieces piled on top of each other. It came with a small pile of chips, and a side of guacamole and a spicy mayo. I used both of those on the sandwich, and they added a lot of flavor.   To be honest, the thing that drew us in was the promise of the "salad garnish" that was supposed to come with the burger. It didn't materialize, but I was okay with that at the end. My husband liked his burger - though it was meat topped with meat in addition to meat.   We were pleasantly surprised by the food, service and beer selection. I'm glad we took a chance and went in.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Highland Burger
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cullen Skink
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bar and dining

p9JryCKkAFWaRqIOfopVwQ.text: Had a nice breakfast here and it's right on the royal mile so that was nice and convenient. Really didn't have much just ate and ran

IVjC5Z72kYj3PwGH2zslbw.text: Great pub off the Royal Mile. I don't know who McGregor is, but I royally liked the pub. My sister and I enjoyed an aperitif after dinner here when we wandered past this place.   We sat at the bar and made chit chat with the very pleasant bartender. We were heading out of Scotland the next day and I wanted to try Irn Bru, which is the beloved soft drink of the country. I did NOT like the first drink, but over time it wasn't so bad. It was very odd tasting, like bubble gum cough syrup. I know you're like, "Gross, you drank it all?" Yup, and I'd do it again. It used to have way more sugar, but the company changed the composition after the sugar tax. Not much has changed flavor-wise, not that I would know...  My sister tried the whisky flight, and the best tasting one ended up being the one from Japan. Yeah, Japan makes a pretty good whisky and I was a little shocked it beat out the other Scottish 'skys. For those reading this in Anchorage AK head to Ginger, they serve this there. Good place, but probably won't come again due to location.  On another note, I met a man in London who told me that Scotland used to be the center of Pangaea, so it's the only country that retains all 5 different soils and why the peat is so popular during whisky making. I state this fact based on zero research conducted on his statements.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky flight, McGregor Recommends.
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Irn Bru, Scotland&#39;s beloved cola and hangover cure

G5z4oEfFVCr8xgQOQraRvw.text: Good food! Staff weren't very attentive, food took awhile. I tried their haggis and a few bites of the fisherman's pie. It was my first time trying haggis so I didn't know what to expect but now that I've had it in another place I'd say it was just good but not the best. The fisherman pie was delicious! Had a bite of the mushroom linguine which was good and rich too. The portions are huge here and it's a tight cozy spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fisherman pie
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon filet

NSBBvVt1WBsJpNrHG70fvQ.text: Here's a pub that has it's s**t together. Seriously.  It's a pub. But they have at least a couple of interesting beers on tap, some bottles on the wall that are not bog-standard, the food is just a wee bit better than "very good", the staff is friendly to a fault, the inside is clean, oh, I could go on. The bottom line is that the place seems to give a damn, and that makes all the difference in the world.  So no, this isn't a "Destination" spot. Then again, if you're on the way to the castle, or just in the hood, it's a perfectly good place to stop for a bite and a drink...  Oh, btw, the food really *is* better than expected. The fish 'n chips is really good, but that's (somewhat) easy. The other stuff on the menu though, oh, is actually, surprisingly, good

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

pkEOl-hXykh43cuSpm5yxQ.text: Food was delicious and the beer great and service was prompt and friendly! I would highly recommend it.

KkHzn0IWdsh_tCew-YgtHA.text: This is the place i decided to go to try my first haggis. We ordered the haggis tower with whisky sauce and it was absolutely delicious! We also tried the steak and ale pie and that one was also super yummy!!! I highly recommend both. As the 3rd entree we ordered haggis burger. It was good but basic, also came with whisky sauce. We had whisky flight and it was nice to try 3 different whiskey styles from different regions. The baileys latte needs more baileys in it. Overall i was happy with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis tower delish!
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak and ale pie get this!
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis burger

vpOm3mnFHhZ57ketu6z3nA.text: - overall rating: 3.5 - recommend: fish and chips, this is my ideal fish and chips, cooked perfectly, flaky batter  - attentive staff - crofter's chicken offered a generous portion but was overwhelmed by gravy/sauce, it was hard to taste anything else (the chicken or haggis), very heavy/hearty

X0VWNea18-T8JehL-lirjA.text: This pub was a nice finding while we were walking on the touristic area. Prices are very reasonable and dishes are really good! The staff was really nice and always smilling and laughing. Totally recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis tower
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken

MVPktMgrVEkGt8ocabCAqg.text: Located just beside where many of the ghost tours begin, we picked this place purely on convenience alone. Happily, we stumbled on a great place to have dinner!!   I had the Crofters Chicken and it was a well put together dish. I had to wolf it down in a hurry but I enjoyed the meal. The chicken was moist, the layer of haggis inside gave it something extra and the whiskey sauce brought a great creaminess. The service was great even though we were in a hurry.  Sad that I didn't get to try the whiskey, but it's the perfect excuse to return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crofters Chicken: chicken breast stuffed with haggis in a whiskey cream sauce and seasonal veggies. (11.50 pounds)

FpChVWPomzL4OvKraZiREw.text: This location faces the Royal Mile, and is of course busy based upon their location in a major area in the city.  Even more so, it was extremely busy on the day that I visited, during the Edinburg festivals.  The decor is clean but traditional.  Often, this location is booked for private parties, so make sure you can get a reservation ahead of time if you want to avoid disappointment.   The food is completely traditional Scotish fare.  They had haggis, whisky, and various other dishes, including sticky toffee pudding dessert.  Delicious and well prepared.   The service wasn't bad by any means, but was possibly the only negative.  The servers seemed extremely busy, which was understandable, and probably not typical, but it made for slower than expected wait times.  I would definitely come back, however.

f8ULwC-qPdihj3OxoWyC-A.text: This place has some of the best breakfast food around. I went for the big breakfast but really nobody needs that much food in my opinion. The Haggus and blood sausage was way beyond expectations with the beans, ham, eggs all definitely crowd pleasers. Good service was there, but they did have a hard time keeping up as people started filling in. A from me!

GNtvTgeLQDRJITnUc9YOhQ.text: Good service, quiet ambience (at least when I was there).....had the Scottish breakfast and Porridge....good food, decent prices....a solid 4 Stars!

PXyD_Q0OAVN8hCKwABeE2g.text: Cold canned tomato soup. Not impressed. Good service. I think they offered to remove the soup charge, but we just wanted to get out of there so e just paid the bill and left.

R9yVpUX2ZIknXdA4u5DR6w.text: Phenomenal! The Hot Husband and I tried haggis fritters, hot port, fish and chips, and the steak and ale pie. Though we left completely stuffed, we had zero regrets. I love that they have a check-in discount as well!  They also have a really nice selection of whiskey and local beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hot Port- Delicious!
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

yHU5WSR3FsqapN1tTNU92w.text: The Royal McGregor off the Royal Mile was pretty cozy place to spend a very rainy evening in Edinburgh.  It's not very big place inside but very good Scottish Food.   I had grilled scottish salmon which had the perfect crispy exterior tender middle.  The appetizers were great and the haggis burger is not bad at all.  The bar was perfect size to order drambuie and scotch and just think about life or talk about world peace with the nice bartenders.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Royal McGregor - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

RBSLb2jHXLCDjxugGrdn6w.text: Food and location are top. Staff were very poor on the occasion I was there. Would likely return when with friends visiting Edinburgh looking for Scottish fayre.

rq-dWsEK_rniTBsiQxsbWg.text: This pub located on the Royal Mile is touristy with decent but touristy prices. They aren't bad, and it's great if you want a drink and a hot meal. The service was good once the menu's were on the table. Once again our dinner consisted of Haggis, nips and tatties and a cheeseburger. The burger was 7 pounds, very meaty and big and came with chips and salad. The haggis, nips and tatties were neatly arranged in a fat, perfectly circular tower, garnished with greens on top and surrounded by a moat of gravy. I sampled the haggis and it was MMMMMM MMMM GOOD!    There is also a 7 pound walking tour during the day and a 5 pound ghost tour that starts 9.30pm outside this pub, just FYI.

vUjgBE8sIG_yb-QmbX8kxQ.text: The sticky toffee pudding is life changing. The best I've ever had.

nQc1wPK7h0cJztr_sQ7z3g.text: Stopped in for quick drink prior to a tour and if the lack of service was the only problem that would be understandable but the drinks were so bad we couldn't choke them down! If the drinks were that bad I am certainly glad we didn't eat there!! I would say this is a miss!! Great location but absolutely the worst drink we've ever had.

SH1gtH3SqUfLHZ0cvpcy_Q.text: We went out looking for a full Scottish recovery breakfast during the Fringe, and this place did a decent job. A generous plateful of food and strong black coffee were exactly what was needed to help quieten our shouting hangovers. Friendly staff and good service.

aI1A-t79ETKcIW6yukstmg.text: Nice little place, right on the royal mile.  Ate a very decent Traditional Scottish Breakfast, my friend had chicken breast stuffed with bacon and haggis.  Both good.  I would return quite happily.

QVprTsJiKegzRc4cam6zvw.text: Stopped in for lunch on my second day in Edinburgh. Nice little place with a few table out front.  All the servers and bar staff were very welcoming. Decided I was going to try Haggis for the first time so I started with the Haggis Fritters. They are very good and not at all scary like I thought they would be. There were three in the appetizer order so you can share with the table.  Had the steak and ale pie for the main course and it was a quite large portion. My friend had the fish and chips and he liked them as well.  I would recommend the Royal Mcgregor to any hungry sightseers that happen to be in the Old Town walking down the Royal Mile.

6RyY01p-VJDO1lAQ-cgfSA.text: stopped in here for lunch and i was NOT disappointed.  the wait staff and  bartender provided excellent service and had great personalities.
